The claim was verified by referring to t: an annual estimate of population characteristics conducted by the U.S. Census Bureau.
The Washington Post compiled a: Top 100" list based on the data from the survey, which confirmed that seven out of the top 10 highest-income counties in the country are located in the greater Washington, D.C. area.
Stephen Fuller: director of the Center for Regional Analysis at George Mason University, provided expert analysis confirming that the D.C. area ranks highly in factors such as the number of workers per household, labor-force participation rate, low unemployment, and years completed in school.
Salim Furth: a senior policy analyst at the conservative Heritage Foundation, mentioned additional rankings that support the claim, such as Washington's high ranking in millionaires per capita and median gross rent.
